name: Tezos Baking guide by Sebuh Honarchian: RPI4 / NVME / LEDGER Edition
description:
A descriptive guide on how to setup a Tezos Baker with a Ledger Nano S, A Raspberry pi 4 8GB, and a 256GB NVME with an USB3.0 Enclosure.

------------------------
Text of PDF Document
------------------------

Big shout out to Eli for helping me put this guide together. We put this guide together from multiple guide sources that were available but a little outdated. 

For any help join @sebuh_net_chat on Telegram.

Here is my recommended parts list for setting up a Tezos Baker at home with RPI 4 8GB / NVME / LEDGER 

Part One: Order Parts.
https://amzn.to/3sOoldp - 256GB NVME
https://amzn.to/3aDPCcs - NVME Enclosure
https://amzn.to/3gCUxhr - RPI4 8GB
https://amzn.to/3tPYaEM - RPI Power Supply
https://amzn.to/3vjH0zu - RPI4 Heatsink/Case/Fan
https://amzn.to/3xqocRd - Battery Backup
https://amzn.to/2QnqWOF - HDMI to Micro HDMI Adapter
https://amzn.to/2S2RFAp - USB 3.0 Hub
https://amzn.to/3gChUb2 - Ledger Nano S


After parts arrive Assemble the case and nvme drive.

Prepare .IMG for the nvme

Download the USB-BOOT-Image
https://mega.nz/file/DB1g2SyY#wVn8avwNDvGoXmO6dEkahRICR00wcMBd4ZmNDVOmoF0
Unzip it.

Use Raspberry Pi Imager tool to load image onto the NVME.
https://www.raspberrypi.org/blog/raspberry-pi-imager-imaging-utility/

Connect the NVME to the Blue USB port on the RPI.
Plug in the PSU, Plug in Ethernet, Connect it to your Network.
You can connect a keyboard and HDMI monitor if you want to see it during bootup.

If working headless you need to find the RPI4 on your network. I use my Routers Dashboard called Attached Devices and I can find the RPI4 this way and take note of its IP address.
Find it on network via ethernet. 
Log in as user: ubuntu password: ubuntu via ssh. on Windows you can use Putty for ssh.
Download Putty here.
https://www.chiark.greenend.org.uk/~sgtatham/putty/latest.html

After first login you change the password. 
Update the Timezone on the RPI to your Timezone. This helps the clock sync.
sudo timedatectl set-timezone America/Los_Angeles
Install updates for Ubuntu/RPI.
sudo apt update 
Perform upgrades to the RPI and reboot.
sudo apt upgrade
sudo shutdown -r now



Next Phase we begin installing Tezos

sudo apt-get install build-essential git m4 unzip rsync curl bubblewrap libev-dev libgmp-dev pkg-config libhidapi-dev jbuilder screen dune cargo -y
wget https://sh.rustup.rs/rustup-init.sh
chmod +x rustup-init.sh
./rustup-init.sh --profile minimal --default-toolchain 1.52.0 -y



source $HOME/.cargo/env
git clone https://gitlab.com/tezos/tezos.git
cd tezos
git checkout latest-release
git rev-parse HEAD
sudo add-apt-repository ppa:avsm/ppa
sudo apt update  (---This gave an error but works)
opam init --bare
sudo apt install opam -y

(you should be asked two questions at this step, both answers should be n)
opam update
eval $(opam env)
wget https://raw.githubusercontent.com/zcash/zcash/master/zcutil/fetch-params.sh
chmod +x fetch-params.sh
sudo ./fetch-params.sh
make build-deps
(this usually takes more than an hour or two- but takes 25ish minutes overclocked+SSD)
eval $(opam env)
make

(15 minutes ish)
export PATH=~/Tezos:$PATH
source ./src/bin_client/bash-completion.sh
export TEZOS_CLIENT_UNSAFE_DISABLE_DISCLAIMER=Y
./tezos-node identity generate
Getting the Snapshot to sync the blockchain quickly.
sudo apt install curl
Get the link for latest full snapshot and do something like this
Goto https://snapshots-tezos.giganode.io/ and copy the full snapshot link for mainnet.
curl -o snapshot.full https://ipfs-tezos.giganode.io/ipfs/QmPrh2qEXeZbZJnn8ssaRaXWPo2amf5U4GfuGNTdxgGR6n
./tezos-node snapshot import snapshot.full
After the snapshot is done we can start the node.
screen -dmS TezosNode
screen -r TezosNode
nohup ./tezos-node run --rpc-addr 127.0.0.1:8732 --connections 10 > node.out &
Hold CTRL and press A than D. to detach from the screen.
Now we wait for the node to become bootstrapped.
You can watch the node getting bootstrapped with the next command.
tail -f node.out
Also you can watch with this other command.
./tezos-client bootstrapped


ubuntu@ubuntu:~/tezos$ ./tezos-client bootstrapped
